intro: Limonium globulariaefolium subsp. lusitanicum, commonly known as the Lusitanian sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit. The plant produces small, showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in dune environments. Its salt tolerance makes it well adapted to maritime climates and harsh coastal conditions.
